intro: Dynamidium vernum, commonly known as the spring dynamidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often tinged with purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive yet relatively rare species in its native habitat.
